page.title: 06WOLSTONS INFORMATION SYSTEMS
page.content: Wolston's main{communication}system is through its modern telephone exchange with its up-to-date System X exchange which is one of the first in British Telecom's Â£6,000,000,000 digital future. {Computers}are used as learning aids in both the first and the secondary schools. They are also used by the Police as an important communication with headquarters where a computer control is in operation. The local policeman demonstrated the speed at which he could call up a vehicle check by this system with his {two-way radio}. Wolston library is only open for two part-days a week but is well frequented as it serves other local villages. The post office occupies part of the local haberdashery shop.{Royal Mail}is still distributed to other parts of the country via Coventry sorting office.
